events.title: â€˜I just want to stop hearing about itâ€™: a weary South Korea awaits verdict on Yoon insurrection charges

When Yoon stands in courtroom 417 of Seoul central district court on Thursday to hear his fate, which will be broadcast live, he will do so in the same room where the military dictator Chun Doo-hwan was sentenced to death three decades ago. The charge is formally the same. Last time, it took almost 17 years and a democratic transition to deliver a verdict. This time, it has taken 14 months. At about 10am, a white van pulled up: several men jumped out and dragged Montenegro and a co-worker inside before speeding off. events.title: US boards second oil tanker in Indian Ocean after it fled Venezuelan raid

Venezuela had faced US sanctions on its oil for several years, relying on a shadow fleet of falsely flagged tankers to smuggle crude into global supply chains. Donald Trump ordered a quarantine of sanctioned tankers in December to pressure the president, NicolÃ¡s Maduro, before Maduro was apprehended in January during a US military operation. events.title: Germany inflation rises 2.1% at start of 2026
events.description: Increases in food and fuel prices were the main drivers of inflation in Germany, new statistics confirmed.

events.title: US civil rights leader Jesse Jackson dies at 84
events.description: Prominent Baptist minister and longtime figure in the US civil rights movement Jesse Jackson has died. Jackson became a political force after working closely with Martin Luther King Jr. and running for president.

events.title: Germany news: Coalition mulls social media ban for children
events.description: Germany is joining the list of nations considering a ban on social media for children, with both coalition partners drawing up plans. Meanwhile, figures show German industry cut around 124,000 jobs in 2025. DW has more.

events.title: Australia rules out repatriating citizens from Syrian camp
events.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese refused help for Australians linked to suspected IS fighters who are trying to return home from Syria's Roj detention camp.

events.title: Rio Carnaval float draws criticims over Lula tribute
events.description: A parade float praising Brazil's president Lula strode through Rio's Sambadrome, drawing controversy and triggering lawsuits.

events.title: 'Apocalypse Now' actor Robert Duvall dies aged 95
events.description: Robert Duvall won an Oscar for "Tender Mercies" and earned nominations for classics including "The Godfather," "Apocalypse Now," and "The Great Santini."

events.title: Follow live: Macron, Modi hold joint press event in Mumbai on AI and defence
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron holds a joint press event with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Mumbai on Tuesday during his three-day visit focused on artificial intelligence cooperation, defence deals and strengthening strategic ties. Follow FRANCE 24's live coverage.

events.title: Modi and Macron to hold talks on multibillion-euro fighter jet deal
events.description: All eyes are on India's Narendra Modi and France's Emmanuel Macron who are set to hold talks over a potential multibillion dollar fighter jet deal as the French president begins a three-day visit to New Delhi for an artificial intelligence summit, FRANCE 24's Navodita Kumari said, adding the India's defence ministry has cleared the path for the purchase of 114 additional Rafale fighter jets at a cost of over 30 billion euros.

events.title: US civil rights activist and African American icon Jesse Jackson dies aged 84
events.description: Rev. Jesse Jackson, a longtime US civil rights leader, two-time presidential candidate and African American icon died on Tuesday aged 84, his family said.

events.title: Imran Khan's doctor not allowed to treat him in jail, spokesman claims
events.description: Former Pakistani prime minister Imran Khan has not received adequate medical treatment in prison after suffering partial vision loss in one eye, his spokesman claims.

events.title: Producer of hit TV spy thriller found dead in hotel room
events.description: The executive producer of hit TV spy thriller Tehran has been found dead in an Athens hotel, police have said.

events.title: List of hundreds of names in Epstein files released
events.description: The Trump administration has been accused of "purposefully muddying the waters" after releasing a list of hundreds of names mentioned in the Epstein files.

events.title: Samba schools honor Black Brazilian female authors during their Carnival parades
events.description: Rio de Janeiro's Carnival is using samba parades to spotlight Black Brazilian women writers who rarely get public recognition

events.title: Malaysia and Japan plan major cross-border carbon capture project, despite climate benefit doubts
events.description: Japan wants to ship carbon emissions to Malaysia in a first-of-its-kind project in Southeast Asia for carbon capture and storage

events.title: A Greenland sled dog champion fears for his culture as climate change melts the ice
events.description: Dog sled culture in northern Greenland is at risk as climate change is causing the ice and snow to melt

events.title: Costa Rican authorities investigate killing of a US citizen in an apparent robbery
events.description: Costa Rican authorities are investigating the killing of a U.S. citizen in what they describe as an apparent robbery

events.title: Photos of Lunar New Year celebrations for the Year of the Horse
events.description: People are celebrating the Lunar New Year on Tuesday, the day that starts the Year of the Horse. This is a photo gallery curated by AP photo editors.

events.description: More than 60 years after the UN launched its formal decolonization drive, Secretary-General AntÃ³nio Guterres on Monday urged renewed commitment to completing the unfinished business of ending colonial rule.

events.title: Gaza: Lifesaving aid operations continue despite restrictions
events.description: Humanitarians in the Gaza Strip continue to face impediments in their efforts to deliver lifesaving aid to the population.

events.title: Indiana school secretary charged after husband finds her with student, probe reveals affair with another: cops

events.description: Former FBI agent Jonny Grusing says he believes the FBI is playing on the Nancy Guthrie suspect's amateurism to get him to turn himself in after two weeks of searching.

events.title: Nancy Guthrie's family members cleared as suspects in disappearance
events.description: Pima County Sheriff Chris Nanos clears Nancy Guthrie's family as suspects in her disappearance case, calling them "victims" who have been cooperative.

events.title: Pennsylvania man accused of stabbing 3-month-old baby after talking 'sacrifice'
events.description: A 44-year-old man in Pennsylvania allegedly spoke about needing to sacrifice his 3-month-old child before stabbing the infant, according to an affidavit.

events.title: Nancy Guthrie case: Ret. FBI agent says bureau preparing for 'parallel realities' while awaiting DNA results

events.title: Shipwreck hunter finds luxury steamer that sank in Lake Michigan in 1872
events.description: After 57 years of searching, shipwreck hunter Paul Ehorn discovered the luxury steamer Lac La Belle that sank in Lake Michigan in 1872 during a gale.

events.title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy says he met with Democratic senators, thanked US for support
events.description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy noted that he thanked America for its support while meeting with U.S. Sens. Richard Blumenthal and Sheldon Whitehouse.

events.title: Man who burned Quran in London may get US asylum as case draws Trump administration attention
events.description: Free speech controversy erupts as the U.K.'s Crown Prosecution Service appeals the overturned conviction of Hamit Coskun, who burned a Quran outside the Turkish Consulate in London.

events.title: Zelenskyy ally arrested trying to flee Ukraine as massive corruption probe deepens
events.description: Ukrainian authorities detained former energy minister Herman Halushchenko in the Operation Midas probe investigating alleged $100 million kickbacks.

events.title: Israeli intelligence sources reject claims Jeffrey Epstein was Mossad operative following document releases
events.description: Israeli officials deny alleged Jeffrey Epstein-Mossad conspiracy theories as Israeli PM Netanyahu and ex-leader Ehud Barak clash over newly released court documents.
